title: Installation issue: cyclic dependency, cairo and librsvg recursively call each other.
body:
Package librsvg depends on cairo from the start, while cairo+svg depends on librsvg since PR #14092
commit dd67868ef66fb72c937e9e9a0bbf00a193918643 on 10 Dec 2019 fom @iarspider.
This leads to a cyclic dependency.
spack install cairo+svg
==> Error: +svg does not satisfy ~svg
Maybe @goxberry could provide hints.

For information, graphviz depends on cairo+svg (through +pangocairo) since PR #16511 commit b9415c6b530ba1dbe0755cc21e2d47768c2b31e0 on 8 May 2020 from @junghans.

Could cairo dependency be only a build dependency ?

Thanks for your help folks.

* **Spack:** 0.16.1-3136-e291fa1b1a
* **Python:** 3.6.9
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu18.04-zen2
* **Concretizer:** original
